<h1 id="wordpress-user-guide">WordPress User Guide</h1>
<p><img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/98/WordPress_blue_logo.svg/1200px-WordPress_blue_logo.svg.png" alt="WordPress logo "></p>
<h2 id="introduction">1. Introduction</h2>
<h3 id="overview--for-wordpress.-wordpress-is-a-powerful-content-management-system-cms-that-allows-you-to-create-and-manage-websites-.">1.1 Overview  for WordPress. WordPress is a powerful content management system (CMS) that allows you to create and manage websites .</h3>
<p><img src="https://ahrefs.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/image4.png" alt="WordPress homepage "><br>
<strong>### 1.2 Purpose of the User Guide: This guide is designed to help users understand and navigate WordPress, covering essential features and providing guidance on maximizing its capabilities.<br>
<strong>##</strong># 1.3 Target Audience: it’s an ideal choice for individuals and small businesses. whether you’re a blogger or startup</strong>**</p>
<h2 id="user-interface-overview">2. User Interface Overview</h2>
<p>WordPress Dashboard and homepage<br>
<img src="https://wordpress.org/documentation/files/2018/10/500px-dashboard.png" alt="WordPress homepage "><br>
<strong>2.1 Main Interface Elements  - The <strong>Dashboard</strong> is the central hub for site management, displaying key information and quick access to various functions. - Other main elements include the <strong>Toolbar</strong>, <strong>Sidebar</strong>, and <strong>Widgets</strong><br>
WordPress Dashboard elements</strong><br>
<img src="https://wordpress.org/documentation/files/2018/10/administrations_screen_4.9.4_with_note.jpg" alt="WordPress homepage "></p>
<h3 id="menus-buttons-icons-and-components-----menus-wordpress-has-navigation-menus-that-allow-you-to-organize-and-structure-your-sites-content.----buttons-and-icons-interactive-components-such-as-the-publish-button-and-media-upload-icon.">2.2 Menus, Buttons, Icons, and Components  -  <strong>Menus:</strong> WordPress has navigation menus that allow you to organize and structure your site’s content. -  <strong>Buttons and Icons:</strong> Interactive components, such as the <strong>Publish</strong> button and media upload icon.</h3>
<p><img src="data:image/png;base64," alt="WordPress homepage "></p>
<h2 id="features-and-functionality">3. Features and Functionality</h2>
<h3 id="major-features">2 Major Features</h3>
<h4 id="feature-1-themes----choose-and-customize-the-look-of-your-site.------how-to-use">Feature 1: Themes  - Choose and customize the look of your site. - <img src="https://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/blocksy.jpg" alt="Themes Screenshot"> - <strong>How to Use:</strong></h4>
<p><strong>1. Navigate to <strong>Appearance &gt; Themes</strong>.<br>
2. Click on <strong>Add New</strong> to browse and install themes</strong>.</p>
<h4 id="feature-2-plugins----extend-the-functionality-of-your-site.---">Feature 2: Plugins  - Extend the functionality of your site. - <img src="https://i2.wp.com/wordpress.org/documentation/files/2019/01/add-plugins.png?fit=1047%2C578&amp;ssl=1" alt="Plugins Screenshot"></h4>
<ul>
<li><strong>How to Use:</strong><br>
<strong>1. Go to <strong>Plugins &gt; Add New</strong>.</strong><br>
<strong>2. Search for a plugin and click <strong>Install Now</strong>.</strong></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="user-permissions-and-security">4. User Permissions and Security</h3>
<h4 id="user-roles-and-permissions">4.1 User Roles and Permissions</h4>
<p><strong>- WordPress has different user roles:</strong><br>
<strong>Administrator, Editor, Author, Contributor, and Subscriber.</strong><br>
<strong>- Each role has specific permissions for managing content and settings.</strong></p>
<h3 id="security-features-and-settings">4.2 Security Features and Settings</h3>
<p><strong>- Utilize features like two-factor authentication and strong passwords</strong></p>
<p><strong>Settings:</strong><br>
<strong>- Enable <strong>SSL</strong> for secure connections.</strong><br>
<strong>- Regularly update WordPress and plugins for security  patches.</strong></p>
<p><strong>Contact details for customer support:</strong><br>
<strong>1. Press the logo in the top left corner choice supports from the menu  logo -&gt; support.<br>
2. Then you have a lot of options how to contact the support department as shown in the picture</strong></p>
<p><strong>WordPress  Community Support website:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><strong><a href="https://wordpress.org/support/forums/">https://wordpress.org/support/forums/</a></strong><br>
<strong>Video:</strong><br>
<strong>- In this video, we will show a quickly review to the general idea of ​​the site and how to use</strong><br>
<strong>- <a href="https://youtu.be/Kfralfk_i8o?si=dJErHC4IDW2VjH_8">https://youtu.be/Kfralfk_i8o?si=dJErHC4IDW2VjH_8</a></strong></li>
</ul>
